terminology.description: Simplify phrases like 'in order to' to 'to'
Avoid archaic or legalese terms; use modern, plain language equivalents
Ensure proper use of 'must' instead of 'shall' for requirements
Avoid unnecessary qualifiers; use precise language
Ensure consistent singular/plural usage (e.g., 'data is,' 'criteria are,' 'phenomena are')
Avoid using 'above' for references
Avoid using 'below' for references
Avoid using 'aforementioned' as it can be unclear
Avoid using 'preceding' for references; specify the section or item explicitly
Avoid using 'latter'; specify the item explicitly
Avoid using 'former'; specify the item explicitly
Avoid using 'respectively' as it can be confusing in complex lists
Avoid using 'per above'; provide a direct reference
Avoid using 'as mentioned earlier'; provide a direct reference
Avoid using 'as stated earlier'; provide a direct reference
Avoid using 'in question'; specify the item explicitly
Avoid using 'and/or'; rewrite the sentence to be more specific about the conditions

periods.description: Avoid ending sentences with only a period (check for sentence fragment)
